decision_conditions: Given the nature of the proposed amendment and considering the original planning conditions, the proposal would meet the Council's criteria for non-material amendments due to the following reasons:

- 	There would be no material impact on any neighbours or other statutory and non-statutory bodies, and the resulting scheme would not be materially different in its external appearance and would remain within the fee paid and in accordance with the adopted policies of the Council.
- 	The changes would not compromise the overall design and appearance of the development.
-  	The resulting scheme would not conflict with any existing planning conditions or legal agreement.

Therefore, the proposal represents a 'non-material' change from the original planning application with regards to Section 96A of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and will not require assessment through the submission of a full planning application.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved drawings and documents: COVER LETTER Rev.01; 2001 Elevation Sheet 1 (South and West); 2002 Elevation Sheet 2 (North and East); 1014 Proposed Roof Plan; Overheating Analysis Report; 1251-LDA-ZZ-ZZ-DR-L-9000 Urban Green Factor Plan
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
description: Application for a Non-Material Amendment in (S96a) seeking to allow changes include the omission of the Brise Soleils, removal of inset brickwork details and repositioning of the rain water goods and change from green roof to brown roof  in relation to planning permission reference 221003FUL dated 06/10/2022 for 'Demolition of the former social club and redevelopment to provide a 4 storey building comprising 26 flats (Use Class C3) with associated on-street disabled parking, cycle storage, refuse and recycling storage, amenity space, playspace, landscaping and other associated works (Regulation 3 Council's own development) '
